basic_info.description: My name my name is Anthony Morton. I am a full-stack web developer. I have a background in industrial hygiene, and I also have a bachelorâ€™s degree in occupational health and safety from Columbia Southern University. Before my time as an industrial hygienist, I served 9 years in the United States Marine Corps where I was a motor transport operator and an imagery analyst. My skills include leadership, teamwork, and adaptability. During my time in the Marines, I enjoyed being a leader and I found being a leader was most rewarding when I was able to help my subordinates advance their careers and get promoted. I also enjoyed using teamwork to build comradery and that comradery was one of my favorite parts of being a Marine. Currently, I am hoping to find a role in automation. I am particularly interested in automation that helps with worker safety. Engineering controls are one of the most efficient ways to keep a worker safe and one of the more effective engineering controls is the use of automation

projects.title: Animal Shelter
projects.description: The most expanded application I had opportunity to work with. I've learned many technologies and my code was reviewed by awesome curator. Application handles all adoption processess and allows to store all evidence on adopting animals from animal shelter.

projects.title: Photography
projects.description: Personal project for study subject. I was responsible for testing photography application that optimizes images with popular algorithms used by graphic editors like Pixlr or Adobe Photoshop. I've earned A grade :)

projects.title: 3D Object Viewer
projects.description: One of the first apps I was working on my internship. I had to develop front-end implementation for app that shows 3D models of known buildings. This was also my first project in Angular framework. I've learned a lot!
